snippet: The Obama administration said that the 2008 conviction of a Guantánamo Bay prisoner was valid even though charges against him were not war crimes under international law.
abstract: Obama administration says 2008 conviction of Guantanamo Bay prisoner Ali al-Bahlul was valid even though charges against him were not war crimes under international law; Atty Gen Eric H Holder Jr will press forward with case, fighting appeal of guilty verdict.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said that the 2008 conviction of a Guantánamo Bay prisoner was valid even though charges against him were not war crimes under international law.

headline.main: U.S. to Press Fight of Detainee’s Appeal
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Press Fight of Detainee’s Appeal

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
